newsitem.title: SPAIN: Tabacalera falls on Tabaqueira bid news.
newsitem.headline: Tabacalera falls on Tabaqueira bid news.

text.p: Shares in Tabacalera were sharply lower on Tuesday amid expectations that a consortium including U.S. rival Philip Morris would be chosen over the Spanish firm to take a stake in Portugal's Tabaqueira, dealers said.
At 1245 GMT Tabacalera was down 180 pesetas, or 3.75 percent to 4,620, having fallen 5.5 percent on Monday. The Ibex-35 index was down 0.94 percent to 4,343.58.
Philip Morris would become much stronger competition for Tabacalera if its bid for a stake in Tabaqueira is favoured, as expected, analysts explained.
"The important thing about the offers is not so much that Tabacalera would miss out on Tabaqueira but rather that Philip Morris would (win)," said an analyst.

An analyst at Ibersecurities in Madrid said, "The market is discounting the worst scenario which is that Philip Morris would keep Tabaqueira and in the next few years start to distribute its products."
Tabacalera produces Philip Morris brands Marlboro and L&M in Spain, under licence.
Sources at Tabacalera told Reuters that its Marlboro licence expires on January 1, 2006 and its L&M licence runs out on January 1, 2010.
But some said the fall in the shares so far had been extreme.
"The slide is somewhat exaggerated," said a dealer at ABN-Amro.
